item.title: Cody add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "The individual has always had to struggle to keep from being overwhelmed by the tribe. If you try it, you will be lonely often, and sometimes frightened. But no price is too high to pay for the privilege of owning yourself." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Cody add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "It is not a lack of love, but a lack of friendship that makes unhappy marriages." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Cody add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "I'm not upset that you lied to me, I'm upset that from now on I can't believe you." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Cody add a quote by Friedrich Wilhelm Nietzsche
item.description: "We should consider every day lost on which we have not danced at least once." -- Friedrich Wilhelm Nietzsche

item.title: Cody add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "The advantage of a bad memory is that one enjoys several times the same good things for the first time." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Cody add a quote by George R.R. Martin
item.description: "We all need to be mocked from time to time, lest we take ourselves too seriously." -- George R.R. Martin

item.title: Cody add a quote by Voltaire
item.description: "Man is free at the instant he wants to be." -- Voltaire

item.title: Cody add a quote by Voltaire
item.description:
"I have never made but one prayer to God, a very short one: Oh Lord, make my enemies ridiculous. And God granted it."
(<i>Letter to Étienne Noël Damilaville</i>, May 16, 1767)" -- Voltaire

item.title: Cody add a quote by Voltaire
item.description: "Judge a man by his questions rather than by his answers." -- Voltaire

item.title: Cody add a quote by Voltaire
item.description: "God is a comedian playing to an audience that is too afraid to laugh." -- Voltaire

item.title: Cody add a quote by Voltaire
item.description: "Ice-cream is exquisite. What a pity it isn't illegal." -- Voltaire

item.title: Cody add a quote by Voltaire
item.description: "Every man is guilty of all the good he did not do." -- Voltaire

item.title: Cody add a quote by Pierre-Augustin Caron de Beaumarchais
item.description:
"Nowadays what isn't worth saying is sung.
(<i>Aujourd'hui ce qui ne vaut pas la peine d'être dit, on le chante.</i>)" -- Pierre-Augustin Caron de Beaumarchais

item.title: Cody add a quote by Voltaire
item.description: "We are intelligent beings: intelligent beings cannot have been formed by a crude, blind, insensible being: there is certainly some difference between the ideas of Newton and the dung of a mule. Newton's intelligence, therefore, came from another intelligence" -- Voltaire

item.title: Cody add a quote by Voltaire
item.description: "I would rather obey a fine lion, much stronger than myself, than two hundred rats of my own species." -- Voltaire

item.title: Cody add a quote by Voltaire
item.description: "I should like to know which is worse: to be ravished a hundred times by pirates, and have a buttock cut off, and run the gauntlet of the Bulgarians, and be flogged and hanged in an auto-da-fe, and be dissected, and have to row in a galley -- in short, to undergo all the miseries we have each of us suffered -- or simply to sit here and do nothing?' That is a hard question,' said Candide." -- Voltaire

item.title: Cody add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "The person, be it gentleman or lady, who has not pleasure in a good novel, must be intolerably stupid." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Cody add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "I have never let my schooling interfere with my education." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Cody add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "I find television very educating. Every time somebody turns on the set, I go into the other room and read a book." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Cody add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "I believe in Christianity as I believe that the sun has risen: not only because I see it, but because by it I see everything else." -- C.S. Lewis
